reviews.text: Comfortable room with easy to sleep bed and stingingly hot shower (easy to control to not be so hot if unlike me you like a less hot shower), panoramic views of other skyscrapers, liberally stocked and replenished room (fruit, soap and toiletries just keep on appearing) and helpful staff. The guarantee they want on the cc is 1000 RMB a day, but you can negotiate that block down to about half if (like me) you don't like hotels sticking huge blocks on your card while you're travelling on business. Great conference facililties, and a classy mall is built onto the hotel.
reviews.title: They've got hospitality off to a fine art

reviews.text: Stayed here during mid-autumn in September 2012. Only stayed for 1 night after arrived from Shanghai. This hotel located in the business area in Beijing and only step away from Subway station, so very convenience for peoples who want to travel using subway in Beijing.
reviews.title: World class hotel in Beijing

reviews.text: The room is big and clean, but the furniture quite old if we compare to another Shang-rila hotel in China (yes, China World Hotel is a Shang-rila hotel). Restaurant in ground floor is good for buffet dinner, I didn't take breakfast in this hotel because have to go to the airport early morning.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: The hotel is located next to the subway, it is easy to go sightseeing in Beijing City.
reviews.title: trouble in shan gri la

reviews.text: The hotel room is big and clean. However not too many choices for the TV channels.
reviews.title: First time in Beijing

reviews.text: Spacious and luxurious are how I would like to describe the Hotel. It is located in prime area, next to an Exhibition Hall. The staff there are very helpful. They use Tablet to check us in and lead us to another comfortable area. They are also patiently and willingly replying our answers like Muslim Food, Shopping areas and transportation information. A must go Hotel if you want a good traveling experience in Beijing.
reviews.title: Strategic Location, Helpful Staff and Spacious

reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights for a work conference. The conference rooms were well equipped. I loved the buffet breakfast and lunches. But the real treats are the desserts at lunch! Check out there dessert station. I'm usually on a perennial diet, but I did indulge during my stay.
reviews.title: Opulent Hotel with all the Trimmings
Good business hotel in Beijing
reviews.text: A great tip about the hotel - unlike in the rest of Beijing, the wifi provides access to Facebook!!! A great bonus in China!
We stayed here for a conference which was a pleasant experience.
reviews.title: All the ingredients for a good hotel, but something missing

reviews.text: The hotel,lobby is permanently full with people, but once in your room, you get great views of Beijing ( when can see through the city smog which is a city problem not a hotel one).
reviews.title: Good Location, far from airport :-(

reviews.text: I stayed here for 4 nights during a recent business trip. The hotel-arranged airport car service was outstanding, both coming and going. The hotel lobby is five-star and the rooms are very good.
reviews.title: Good location, luxurious rooms, good service

reviews.text: The exercise facility in the basement was good by Asian standards with 6-8 treadmills, plenty of free weights / machines, plus cycles, etc. It would have been nice to have an outside view from the gym.
reviews.title: Staff a treat, very comfortable hotel

reviews.text: Internet service was included in the room charge. I never tried the breakfast.
reviews.title: A luxury oasis

reviews.text: The location is very good. The hotel is on top of the Trade Center mall and has pedestrian tunnels to nearby locations, including stops for both the Number 1 and Number 10 subway lines.
reviews.title: Truly, a great hotel.
Solid performance
reviews.text: My only real complaint is that the thermostat didn't seem to warm the room higher than 20 deg cel. It would accept my setting of 22, but the room never got there.
Two night stay with work.
reviews.title: Conference stay

reviews.text: Stayed in the Horizon Club (Executive rooms on top 3 floors). Highly reccommend you do this. Only cost an extra £30 per night.
reviews.title: Five star hotel
Always a pleasure
reviews.text: You get: Private immediate checkin, water and fruit in room, free speedy wifi in room, suit pressing service, use of lounge area with non alcoholic drinks all day, use of meeting room daily, and a two hour slot in the evening where snacks and unlimited booze are served in the lounge. A decent continental breakfast is also served in the club lounge complimentary. I "spent" well over £30 per day on breakfast, drinks etc so well worth it as well as the service being even more personalised and professional than in the rest of the hotel. It really was like a mini hotel within a big hotel!
The main hotel lobby is always busy, but theres loads of staff always on hand to direct you / help you. Conference facilities modern and competent
reviews.title: Service, Service, Service - the best!

reviews.text: Do not bother getting the hotels limo service to / from the airport. A taxi will set you back about £8 compared to £50 for the hotel service.
reviews.title: Another wonderful stay
